name: EF6Migration
description: Execute an Entity Framework 6 database migration
author: West Peaks Consulting

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Classic Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target Azure Classic subscription for deploying SQL files

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure RM Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target Azure Resource Manager subscription for deploying SQL files

inputs.name: ServerName
inputs.label: Azure SQL Server Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure SQL Server name, like Fabrikam.database.windows.net,1433 or Fabrikam.database.windows.net.

inputs.name: DatabaseName
inputs.label: Database Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Azure SQL Database, where the files will be deployed.

inputs.name: SqlUsername
inputs.label: Server Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Azure SQL Server administrator login.

inputs.name: SqlPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password for the Azure SQL Server administrator.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release Definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark the variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: MigrationAssemblyFile
inputs.label: Migration Assembly File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the .dll assembly file on the automation agent or on a UNC path accessible to the automation agent like, \\\\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\FabrikamDataModel.dll. Predefined system variables like, $(agent.releaseDirectory) can also be used here. This assembly ** MUST ** contain your data model classes AND your Configuration class, if you're using one (which you really should be).

inputs.name: MigrateExeFile
inputs.label: migrate.exe File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the migrate.exe file (provided in the Entity Framework nuget package) on the automation agent or on a UNC share. Predefined system variables like, $(agent.buildDirectory) or $(agent.releaseDirectory) can also be used here. The 'migrate.exe' file ** MUST ** be in the same directory as the assembly containing your data model classes AND Configuration class (if you're using one, which you should).

inputs.name: AdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional migrate.exe Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional migrate.exe arguments that will be applied when deploying the Entity Framework migration.

inputs.name: EntityFrameworkConfigurationClass
inputs.label: Configuration class
inputs.helpMarkDown: The short class name of the System.Data.Entity.Migrations.DbMigrationsConfiguration<T> descendant used to configure your Entity Framework migration options. e.g. If your fully qualified Configuration class name is AcmeSoftwareProducts.MyProduct.MyDbConfiguration, the value in this field should be 'MyDbConfiguration'.

inputs.name: ConnectionStringName
inputs.label: Connection String Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the connection string used by Entity Framework to connect to your database. Must match the name of the connection string used by your Data Model (DbContext descendant).

inputs.name: IpDetectionMethod
inputs.label: Specify Firewall Rules Using
inputs.helpMarkDown: For the task to run, the IP Address of the automation agent has to be added to the 'Allowed IP Addresses' in the Azure SQL Server's Firewall. Provide the IP Address range of the automation agents, or select to auto-detect in case of hosted automation agent.

inputs.name: StartIpAddress
inputs.label: Start IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The starting IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.50.

inputs.name: EndIpAddress
inputs.label: End IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The ending IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.65.

inputs.name: DeleteFirewallRule
inputs.label: Delete Rule After Task Ends
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, then after the task ends, the IP Addresses specified here are deleted from the 'Allowed IP Addresses' list of the Azure SQL Server's Firewall.

messages.SAD_InvalidServerAddress: Either IPAddress mentioned is not a valid IPv4 address or Sql database server: '{0}' does not exist.
messages.SAD_InvalidIPv4Address: IPAddress mentioned is not a valid IPv4 address.
messages.SAD_FoundMoreFiles: Found more than one file to deploy with search pattern {0}. There can be only one.
messages.SAD_NoFilesMatch: No files were found to deploy with search pattern {0}
messages.SAD_NoPassword: No password specified for the SQL User: '{0}
messages.SAD_InvalidServerNameFormat: Server name '{0}' is not in the right format. Use FQDN format like '{1}
